author: Megan Hess
title: Functional Paradigm Onboarding

assessments.note: Definitely developers are the keys to making all of this a success and whatever assist community developers demands attention as well as resources. I'ts a great challenge ahead but with a hub for expert developers are a treasure for entrepreneurs looking to find answers on how it can ll come together.
Developer outreach is a key to achieve Cardano's mission. This proposal sounds similar to topics raised by Charles H at a recent AMA.

This proposal speaks of creating a web app using Haskell. That is about all of the information provided in the proposal.
The idea can be good, but there is a difficulty of conveying it. Try explaining clearly what you are proposing exactly.
we already have this initiative from other entities with in the eco system maybe support those initiatives is a better use case ?

Onboarding and training developers is definitely important, especially since Cardano is built on a very specific technology foundation. I just do not see this as Challenge Setting for Fund 6. Why don't you hand this in as a proposal under the Developer Ecosystem campaign ?

The task of onboarding developers into the functional programming paradigm and utilising Haskell is an obvious necessity for Cardano's mission. That said, the proposal as described is a little confusing and does not make clear what the" Management System" web app looks like and what challenge exactly is being set for Fund6.
The community has an abundance of resource and experts to work something out to strengthen that group of professionals. There is the drive, technical knowhow and information to develop this solution.

There are already several proposals across other challenges which aim to train up developers. Perhaps the fact that they have already been captured in others removes the need to add a specific challenge on the topic. In my assessment this need is already being met.
Well, the community is certainly capable to address such a challenge, but again: I see this as a proposal for 'Developer Ecosystem', not as a Fund 6 Challenge Setting.
Given the deep breadth of talented developers within the Cardano ecosystem this challenge for Fund6 is well within the capabilities of the community to acomplish

More clarity how this can be achieved and a clear roadmap could strengthen this solution. Where would it be built on, what will it focus on, and what key challenges improve the community at large. Great challenge, much luck!
Metrics align with the goal of the proposal idea. Growing number of skilled developers.
You have certainly invested some thoughts into this and listed some metrics. Again, in my opinion, this should be a proposal under Developers Ecosystem.

The success criteria is easily measurable by volume of developers successfully completing the functional programming on-boarding program as delivered by the described web app in the proposal. With that being said, it is very difficult to measure the outside effect of developers building real products once completing the described on-boarding and whether or not the developers end up building on Cardano using their new-found functional programming skills.

importance: We get super excited about ADA, but we forget how it was architected and built. Haskell is the real unsung hero behind Cardano
success:
Army of functional programmers (trained throughout app development process)
Fully functional Web app built using Servant, Haskell, and Elm.
